plugins.name: Name Shame
plugins.description:
Name Shame is a lovingly vibe-coded plugin born from one designer‚Äôs deep-seated frustration with default layer names like ‚ÄúRectangle 123‚Äù and ‚ÄúGroup 87.‚Äù Instead of silently suffering, I decided to roast my own poor file hygiene‚Äîand now yours too.


This plugin scans your Figma file for default-named layers, serves up a spicy roast for each offender, and lets you rename them with beautifully ridiculous alternatives like ‚Äúsuch_lazy‚Äù or ‚Äúidentity_crisis.‚Äù Use it for laughs, use it for cleanup, use it because your future self deserves better.


File hygiene matters. Might as well make it fun. üéâ

Creative Director with a love for design systems, clear UI, and a well-organized layer panel.

plugins.name: Zeytal Variables Extractor
plugins.description:
Zeytal helps developers extract and optimize SVGs, transform Figma styles and variables, and generate TailwindCSS config files effortlessly.


This plugin helps Zeytal users leverage their Figma variables.


Zeytal Features

  1. Extract and optimize SVGs
  2. Extract and convert Figma variables to .ts, .js, .json, .css, .scss, .sass, and .less files
  3. Extract and convert Figma styles to .ts, .js, .json, .css, .scss, .sass, and .less files
  4. Convert Figma styles and variables to TailwindCSS v4 config files.


This Plugin

This plugin helps Figma users prepare their Figma files for Figma variables extraction and code generation.


How it works :

  1. Start the plugin.
  2. Click on one button to export your Figma variables to Zeytal
  3. Use Zeytal CLI to generate your code and config files


Everything is explained in detail in Zeytal documentation.
plugins.tagline: From Figma to Code In One Command Line

plugins.name: AI Brand Guide
plugins.description:
AI Brand Guide transforms your design files into comprehensive, professional brand guides in seconds. Extract and organize design elements from your Figma files to create beautiful, developer-friendly documentation.


Key Features

  1. Intelligent Design Element Categorization: Automatically organizes your elements into Buttons, Icons, and Other Elements based on naming patterns
  2. Multi-Frame Export: Choose between Single Frame (all sections in one scrollable frame) or Separate Frames (each section in its own dedicated frame)
  3. Color Palette Extraction: Automatically extracts colors from your selection with detailed RGB, HEX, and HSL values
  4. AI-Powered Color Naming: Generate professional, creative names for your color palette with a single click
  5. Color Theory Generation: Create comprehensive color theory documentation including palette overview, color roles, visual qualities, and usage recommendations
  6. Typography Hierarchy System: Extracts and organizes typography into a structured system with Header and Paragraph classifications
  7. Component Documentation: Displays detailed specifications for buttons, icons and other elements including exact dimensions and padding values
  8. Visual Previews: Generates thumbnail previews for all design elements
  9. Form Element Detection: Special handling for contact forms and other form elements with improved display


How It Works

  1. Select your design elements in Figma (frames, components, or entire pages)
  2. Generate your brand guide with a single click
  3. Customize your guide: Rename colors, add color theory, or organize elements
  4. Export to Figma: Choose your preferred layout style and generate a complete brand guide directly in your Figma file


Element Categorization

For best results, use these naming patterns:

  1. Buttons: Include "btn" or "button" in the name (e.g., "btn-primary", "submit-button")
  2. Icons: Include "icn" or "icon" in the name (e.g., "icn-home", "arrow-icon")
  3. Other Elements: Include "element" or "other" in the name (e.g., "card-element", "other-banner")


What's Included in Your Brand Guide

  1. Color Palette: Complete color documentation with visual swatches and color codes
  2. Typography System: Organized type hierarchy with font details and visual examples
  3. Buttons Collection: All button variants with exact dimensions and padding specifications
  4. Icon Library: Organized icon set with dimensions and specifications
  5. Additional Elements: Cards, banners, forms and other UI components with detailed measurements
  6. Color Theory: Optional section providing insights on palette psychology, symbolism and usage


AI Brand Guide helps design teams maintain consistency while giving developers the exact specifications they need to implement designs accurately.
plugins.tagline: Transform designs into comprehensive brand guides with AI-powered color intelligence.

plugins.name: Flatten Vectors Within
plugins.description:
A simple plugin that flattens all vector shapes (such as rectangles, ellipses, lines, and paths) within each selected frame or group into a single vector layer. Each frame or group is processed individually, so layers aren‚Äôt merged throughout. It‚Äôs a quick way to clean up icons or illustrations and make overrides easier when turning them into components.


Created with the help of AI.


How to use the plugin

  1. Select one or more frames or groups that contain vector layers.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. Each frame or group will now contain a single vector layer named Vector.

plugins.description:
Introduction

This Figma plugin allows designers to quickly insert predefined design frames into their projects with just a click. It simplifies the process of applying consistent styles, layouts, and content, enhancing productivity and design consistency.


Features Introduction

plugins.name: WCAG Ëâ≤ÂΩ©ÂØπÊØîÊ£ÄÊü• WCAG Color Checker
plugins.description:
Introduction

This Figma plugin helps you evaluate the contrast ratio between text and background colors in your design frames, ensuring they meet WCAG accessibility standards. Perfect for designers aiming to improve readability and accessibility.


Function Introduction

‚Ä¢Check text-background contrast ratio within selected frames.

‚Ä¢Evaluate contrast according to WCAG standards (AAA, AA, A, Fail).

‚Ä¢Visualize contrast results and interact with your design directly.

‚Ä¢Automatic identification and highlighting of areas needing improvement.


Usage

1.Select a frame in your Figma file.

2.Run the plugin and click ‚ÄúCheck Contrast.‚Äù

3.Review the results, which are sorted by contrast ratio.

4.Click on any result to highlight and improve specific text elements.


Notes

‚Ä¢Ensure text layers are properly named for better result identification.

‚Ä¢The plugin currently supports checking text against solid color backgrounds only.

‚Ä¢For best results, use the plugin on well-structured design frames.

1. Select the layers you wish to populate.

plugins.name: Export-Dims
plugins.description:
With either a single mock or multiple mocks, this plugin lets you grab dimensions, scaled or raw, for mock elements. If the mock elements don't exist, custom regions can be created and defined.


Much of the calculations are based on what's needed to incorporate mocks into a Qualtrics workflow, particularly one that uses sticky headers. For more on that implementation and how to use the data from this plugin in your pipeline please reach out to terrencepope@.

plugins.name: Rename by text list
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you rename multiple layers in bulk using a text-based list.

Simply select two Auto Layout frames:

  1. One containing the elements to rename (any layer type)
  2. One containing text nodes with the desired names

The plugin will rename each element in the first frame using the corresponding text content from the second frame, based on their order in the layers panel.

Introduction

Liquid Glass is a Figma plugin for designers who want to create realistic glassmorphism UI effects effortlessly. It simulates the layered, frosted, and glowing look commonly seen in modern interfaces.


Function Description

‚Ä¢Adds a liquid glass style frame with background blur, angular stroke, and gradient fills

‚Ä¢Includes configurable opacity and blur settings

‚Ä¢Adds optional layered texture for enhanced realism

‚Ä¢Automatically centers the effect on your current viewport


How to Use

1.Run the plugin from the Figma plugins menu

2.Adjust opacity and blur in the popup panel

3.Click ‚ÄúApply‚Äù to generate a liquid glass frame

4.The generated element appears centered in your viewport


Notes

‚Ä¢Works best on light or blurred backgrounds

‚Ä¢You can group the frame with existing UI elements

‚Ä¢Performance may vary with complex canvases

plugins.name: Toko
plugins.description:
Toko ‚Äì Bridge your Figma ‚Äúsource-of-truth‚Äù tokens straight into code


Bring your design system to life without any copy-&-paste errors. With Toko you can:


1. Export any Figma token set

‚Ä¢ Colors, typography, spacing, radius, etc.

‚Ä¢ Output as:


‚Ä¢ CSS variables

‚Ä¢ JSON objects

‚Ä¢ JavaScript modules

‚Ä¢ Tailwind CSS config


2. Generate CSS classes from text styles

‚Ä¢ Automatically map your Figma text styles into CSS class names.

‚Ä¢ No hand-writing class names‚Äîjust pick your style library and go.


3. Push updates directly to GitHub

‚Ä¢ Connect a repo in a few clicks

‚Ä¢ Keep your token files in sync with every Figma change


4. Flexible export options

‚Ä¢ Copy to clipboard

‚Ä¢ Download ready-to-use files

‚Ä¢ Push to your Repo using PAT


---


Why you‚Äôll love Toko


One-click workflow: Stay in Figma‚Äîno jumping between apps.

Design‚Äìdeveloper alignment: Ship the exact values your designers approved.

Always up-to-date: Version your tokens alongside your code.

Team-ready: Invite collaborators, lock down your design system, and roll out across projects.


Ready to stop manual syncing and start shipping design tokens as code? Install Toko and transform your Figma styles into production-ready assets today!
plugins.tagline: Toko converts Figma design tokens into ready CSS, JSON, JS, or Tailwind code, exporting to GitHub!!!

plugins.name: Dialekt
plugins.description:
Stop manually copy-pasting text for different languages! Dialekt helps you visualize localized designs early in your UX process. Simply select a mobile frame containing your text layers, and this plugin will:

  1. Find all text content within the selected frame.
  2. Automatically create five new frames, perfectly aligned.
  3. Translate the text in each new frame into Arabic, Spanish, Dutch, Portuguese, and French.

Ideal for designers working on multi-language apps who need to quickly see how text will look and fit in different languages during the wireframing or mockup stage.


Key Features:

  1. Translates text into 5 pre-set languages: Arabic, Spanish, Dutch, Portuguese, French.
  2. Automatically duplicates the selected frame for each language.
  3. Preserves original layout and styling (text length may vary).
  4. Simple few clicks operation.
plugins.tagline: Translate your designs into multiple languages

plugins.name: Layer Query
plugins.description:
A powerful layer selection plugin that lets you find and select layers based on their design properties and custom component properties. Perfect for managing large design files and design systems efficiently.


## Key Features


- Multi-property search with combination filters

- Custom component property support (boolean, text, variant, instance swap)

- Flexible search scope: Entire file, Current page, Root frame, or Selected frames

- Search results with page grouping and navigation

- Real-time search progress with cancellation support

- Cross-page layer selection and navigation


## Supported Properties


**Typography:** Font size, font family, line height, text alignment, text content

**Fill:** Fill color, opacity

**Size:** Width, height

**Padding:** All directions (top, bottom, left, right, vertical, horizontal)

**Auto Layout:** Direction, sizing, alignment, item spacing

**Stroke:** Stroke color, stroke width

**Corner Radius:** All corners and individual corner values

**Layer:** Layer name, structure, type, opacity

**Position:** X and Y coordinates

**Custom:** Component instance properties


## Perfect For


- Design system maintenance and auditing

- Finding layers with specific styling across large files

- Quality assurance and design consistency checks

- Efficient layer organization and cleanup

- Component property management


Save hours of manual searching with precise property-based queries. Transform your Figma workflow from manual hunting to smart selection.


## Beta Version


This plugin is currently in beta. Please report any issues or feedback to help improve the experience.
plugins.tagline: Query and select layers by properties including custom components. Advanced search for efficiency.

Introduction

Clear Slice is a lightweight utility plugin that helps you remove, hide, or show all Slice layers within selected elements‚Äîideal for cleaning up export slices before delivery.


Function Description

  1. Remove all Slice layers in the selection
  2. Optional: auto-detach instance before processing
  3. Hide or show Slice layers instead of deleting
  4. Simple UI with precise layer control options


How to Use

  1. Select any Frame, Component, or Instance
  2. Open the plugin and toggle "Detach instance" as needed
  3. Click your desired action: Clear / Hide / Show
  4. The plugin processes all nested slices recursively


Notes

  1. Protected components may require manual detaching
  2. Changes are not reversible ‚Äî save your work before use
  3. The plugin processes all child layers in depth
